short_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s: For this puzzle, snap the blocks together and press "▶ Run"!
Snap all blocks together to finish your code, then click "▶ Run".
Add a `North` block to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code, then click "▶ Run".
Drag the extra block back to the toolbox to throw it away.
Can you figure out which block you need to add to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code?
Try this one all by yourself!

Play with these blocks to see what they make Scrat do! 

Get Scrat to the acorn to complete the level.
Use **2** movement blocks to get the Scrat to the acorn.
This puzzle is a little tricky!
Move one way, then another to get Scrat to the acorn!
Figure out what is missing and then add blocks to get Scrat to the acorn!
Your turn!  What do you need to do to get Scrat to the acorn?
Challenge: Move around the broken ice to get Scrat to the acorn.
Fix the bugs to get Scrat to the acorn.
It's all you!  Get Scrat to the acorn.
Now get that acorn any way you can!
Can you find a path before you run out of blocks?
Debug this level. These are the right blocks, but they're in the wrong order!
"Go get the scrap metal, BB-8!"
Get all the metal.
Get all the scrap metal
Get all the scrap metal
Get the scrap metal
Get all the scrap metal
Go get it!
**Challenge:** Help BB-8 gather the glowing scrap metal
Help BB-8 gather the glowing scrap metal
Help BB-8 gather the glowing scrap metal
Help BB-8 gather the glowing scrap metal
Help Scrat across the ice to get to the acorn!
Use two different move blocks to get to the acorn!
Can you get to the acorn with just one `W` block?
Add one more block to get Scrat all the way to the acorn!
Can you add a loop to get to the acorn?
Scrat really wants that acorn!
Can you fix this code?
The acorn is so far away! Can you use loops to help Scrat get there?
Help Scrat get all the way over to the acorn!
Help Scrat get to the acorn!
Get to the acorn any way you can!
Move Laurel around and get as much treasure as you can!
Get all three piles! Move Laurel to each piece of treasure, then use the collect block.
Fix Laurel's path to get all of this treasure.
Use what you learned to get all of the treasure.
Add blocks to this code to get all of the treasure.
What should you add to this code to get all of the treasure?
Write code to get all of this treasure.
**Challenge:** The treasure goes all the way up these stairs!  Write the code to help Laurel get it all.
Help Laurel get all of the treasure along this path.
Help Laurel get all of the treasure from this cave.
_"Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!"_
Collect at least **3** pieces of treasure to pass this level.
_"Can you help me spot some bugs?"_
This is a new type of puzzle called "Artist". Play with the level and draw something fun.
Help the artist draw this line two times forward.
Draw a line forward five times.
Now, use a `repeat` loop to draw this line five times!
Draw a line seven steps long. This will become our horizon.
Let's put a nice hill in the back.
Use the `repeat` loop to add waves to the water.
We need a ladder up to the boat.
Challenge: Fix the stairs.
Help me put down stones so I don't fall in!
Help me build steps to watch the ship sail away.
The artist saw something funny in the distance.  Draw what you think he saw.
_"Help me get these three tents set up!"_
Can you draw a house? Make it look just the way you like it!
Need a better playlab/events combo
This is a Play Lab level.  Move blocks to the workspace and see what happens!
Jorge the Dog wants to say "Hi there."  Can you help him?
Connect the `move left` block to the `when left` event block that is already in the workspace.
Add another event block to get Jorge to move right when the `right` button is clicked.
Add events to have Jorge move up and down when the `up` and `down` buttons are pressed.
Make this more interesting by changing the background and playing a random sound when Jorge is clicked.
_Freeplay:_ Add anything you want to this game.
Give everyone something to do when you click on them.
Can you write code to show the rest of my friends? The hints will help you do this project step-by-step.

long_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s: To get Scrat to the acorn, snap the <xml><block type="maze_moveEast" block-text="move East"/></xml> block to the bottom of the <xml><block type="when_run" block-text="when run"/></xml> block, then press "▶ Run"!

Snap both <xml><block type="maze_moveEast" block-text="move east"/></xml> blocks to the bottom of the <xml><block type="when_run" block-text="when run"/></xml> block to finish your code, then click "▶ Run".
Grab a <xml><block type="maze_moveNorth" block-text="move north"/></xml> block from the toolbox and add it to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code, then click "▶ Run".

There's an extra block at the end of this code!

Drag it back to the toolbox to throw it away.
Can you figure out which block you need to add to the bottom of the other blocks to finish this code?
Try this one all by yourself!
**Challenge:** Move around the broken ice to get Scrat to the acorn.
You only have four of each move block. Can you find a path before you run out of blocks?

[Rey][0]_"Go get the scrap metal, BB-8!"_

Watch out for walls and crates. Scrap metal looks like this: [picture of scrap metal][1]

[][0] _"Keep going, BB-8!"_
[][0] _"Can you get it all?"_
[][0] _"You can do it!"_
[][0] _"Go get it!"_

[][0] _"Keep it up, BB-8."_

**Challenge**: Gather all the scrap metal.
[][0] _"You can do it!"_
[][0] _"Can you get it all?"_
[][0] _"Keep going!"_
Help Scrat across the slippery ice to get to the acorn!
Use both <xml><block type="maze_moveWest" block_text="move west"/></xml> and <xml><block type="maze_moveSouth" block_text="move south"/></xml> blocks to get to the acorn!
Can you get to the acorn with just one <xml><block type="maze_moveWest" block-text="move west"/></xml> block? Try using a loop!
Add one more block to get Scrat all the way to the acorn!
Can you add a loop to get to the acorn?
Scrat really wants that acorn!
Can you fix this code?
The acorn is so far away! Can you use loops to help Scrat get there?
Help Scrat get all the way over to the acorn!
Help Scrat get to the acorn!
Get to the acorn any way you can!

**Free Play:** This is Laurel the Adventurer! Move her around and get as much treasure as you can.

Drag blocks into the workspace and try to figure out how to get treasure.  Get at least one item to pass this level.
Get all three piles! Move Laurel to each piece of treasure, then use the <xml><block type="collector_collect" block-text="get treasure"/></xml> block.
How can Laurel get all five piles of treasure using only one <xml><block type="maze_moveEast" block-text="move east"/></xml> block?

_"Eureka!  Get as much treasure as you can!"_  
(You do not have to get it all.)
_"Can you help me spot some bugs? I know which way I want to go, but I'm not sure how many steps to take."_

Help the artist draw this line two times forward.

### Ideas

_"Help me get the camp site ready!"_

Use the blocks in the toolbox to draw these three tents.

You can use a loop to draw many lines in a row.

Can you draw a house? Make it look just the way you like it!  Try looking for patterns that repeat!

Here are some ideas:

[][0]

Help Jorge the Dog get moving by connecting the <xml><block type="studio_move" block-text="move dog west">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">8</title>
  </block></xml> block to the <xml><block type="studio_whenArrow" block-text="when left arrow">
    <title name="VALUE">left</title>
  </block></xml> event block that is already in the workspace.

Get Jorge to the flag to finish this level!
Now, add another event block to get Jorge to move right when the right arrow button is clicked.
Add events to have Jorge move up and down when the up arrow and down arrow buttons are pressed.
_Freeplay:_ Add anything you want to this game.  Can you make the dinosaur disappear when Jorge runs into him?

Give everyone something to do when you click on them. What will the animals say? What else will happen?

In this puzzle, make sure to click for hints. The hints will give you fun things to try!

[][0]

Clicking Olive will make Robin appear! Can you write code to show the rest of the characters too?

In this puzzle, make sure to click for hints! The hints will help you do this project step-by-step!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.1: If Scrat isn't doing what you want, make sure both of the blocks have been fully clicked together, then click "Run" again.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.2: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Try something, and if it doesn't work, try something else!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.1:
Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveEast">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveEast">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveNorth"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveSouth">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveEast"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveEast">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveEast">
            <next>
              <block type="maze_moveSouth"/>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

Your code should look like this:

<xml>
  <block type="when_run" deletable="false" movable="false">
    <next>
      <block type="maze_moveWest">
        <next>
          <block type="maze_moveWest">
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops5_a: If you can't figure out the answer right away, try using a piece of paper to figure out what arrows you will need and look for a pattern.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops5_c: You'll want to start with a <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loop that moves Laurel west and collects treasure.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops6_a: Can't figure out what's wrong? Try running the code a couple of times to see what happens.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops6_b: The shortest solution has 2 <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loops, one after the other.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops7_a: If you can't figure out what comes next, try running the code to see where Laurel ends up.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops8_a: If you are having trouble figuring this puzzle out, try writing the moves down on a piece of paper and looking for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops8_b: Try breaking this puzzle into 3 separate problems, and writing loops for each.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops8_c: Remember you can write one piece of the code at a time, then press "Run" to figure out where you need to go from there.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops9_a: If you can't spot the best places to use loops, try coding it out step-by-step and look for a pattern.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops9_b: Try putting 2 of your <xml><block type="controls_repeat_simplified_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml> loops inside of another loop to make your code shorter!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_a: Try changing the numbers in each loop if something seems wrong.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_b: You don't need to use a loop if you are only doing something one time.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_c: There are 6 gems on the right side of the cave when you start, but you only need to get treasure 5 times moving South. Do you know why?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_collector_loops_challenge1_d:
The starting program doesn't collect the last 2 gems. Try adding this code at the very end:

<xml><block type="maze_moveEast">
                        <next>
                          <block type="collector_collect_simplified">
                            <next>
                              <block type="maze_moveSouth">
                                <next>
                                  <block type="collector_collect"/>
                                </next>
                              </block>
                            </next>
                          </block>
                        </next>
                      </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_artist_loops2_a: Can't figure out how to draw a line?  Start attaching blocks to the <xml><block type="when_run"/></xml> block to see what happens.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_a: Blocks like this <xml>  <block type="simple_move_up_left"/></xml> will let your artist move at a slant!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_b: When you finish one tent, `jump` up twice to get to the next!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_artist_loops_challenge2_c: All of your blocks will need to be inside of a loop to finish this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events2_a: Look for a block that makes the dog say something.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events2_b:
This is the code you need to complete this puzzle:

<xml>
<block type="when_run" movable="false" deletable="false">
<next>
<block type="studio_saySpriteChoices">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="VALUE">Hi there.</title>
  </block>
</next>
</block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events3_a:
Drag this block  <xml><block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">8</title>
  </block></xml> out and snap it to the bottom of <xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">left</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events3_b: Remember to use the left arrow key to move Jorge to the flag once you have written your program. When the flag turns green, you've finished!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events4_a:
Here is the event block that you will need to get Jorge to move right:

<xml><block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">2</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events4_b:
This is the code you will need to complete this puzzle:

<xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">right</title>
    <next>
  <block type="studio_move">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
    <title name="DIR">2</title>
  </block></next></block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events5_a:
Here are the event blocks that you will need to use to move Jorge up and down:

<xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">up</title>
  </block></xml>

and 

<xml><block type="studio_whenArrow">
    <title name="VALUE">down</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events5_b:
Did you know that you can change the key for  the event arrow by clicking on the picture in the block and choosing a new key?

[][0]

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events6_a:
Here is the event block that you would use to have Jorge do something when clicked:

<xml><block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">1</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events6_b:
Here is the block you would use to change the background:

<xml><block type="studio_setBackground">
    <title name="VALUE">random</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events6_c:
Here is the block you would use to play a random sound:

<xml><block type="studio_playSound">
    <title name="SOUND">random</title>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playLab_events7_a:
Use this block to control what happens when the actors collide.

<xml><block type="studio_whenSpriteCollided">
    <title name="SPRITE1">1</title>
    <title name="SPRITE2">0</title>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_a:
You can make a bird sing.

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
    <next>
          <block type="studio_saySprite">
            <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
            <title name="TEXT">Tweet</title>
          </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_b:
You can make a robot beep.

<xml>
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">6</title>
    <next>
      
          <block type="studio_playSound">
            <title name="SOUND">winpoint</title>
          </block>
        </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge2_c:
You can make an angry monster growl.

<xml>  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSpriteEmotion">
        <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
        <title name="VALUE">2</title>
        <next>
          <block type="studio_saySprite">
            <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
            <title name="TEXT">Roar!</title>
            <next>
              <block type="studio_setSpriteEmotion">
                <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
                <title name="VALUE">0</title>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </next>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_a:
Make Waddles the Penguin show when you click Robin!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">2</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">3</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_b:
Make Boo the Ghost show when you click Waddles!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">3</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">4</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_c:
Make Jayden the Fuzzy Monster show when you click Boo!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">4</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_d:
Make Spiff the Robot show when you click the monster!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">5</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">6</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursea-2019/s.courseA_playlab_events_challenge1_e:
Finally, make Wendel the Wizard show when you click Spiff!

<xml> 
  <block type="studio_whenSpriteClicked">
    <title name="SPRITE">6</title>
    <next>
      <block type="studio_setSprite">
        <title name="VALUE">"visible"</title>
        <title name="SPRITE">7</title>
      </block>
    </next>
  </block></xml>
